commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2042b3cf27250d4dda142de52fd84ebb9f840509
(cherry picked from commit 39cce31345923c00d97b81993764fbd5e4c254b6)
(cherry picked from commit f9d48b0d4389833dfa35d6f92b2be26a11d695a3)

to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib0705b19a26e76b673c566280b82817660fa1b76
(cherry picked from commit 35c6633402c8835d6a431a2d793e7c9915dd18d0)
(cherry picked from commit aff23ceecb2e61b5aadd8f577e25119a84aa27ae)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/64/863364/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD (9c0bde Remove etcdv3 library)======= setup_requires=['pbr>=2.0.0'], py_modules=[], >>>>>>> CHANGE (aff23c setuptools: Disable auto discovery)

commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1777e91b28974980c3d32341435538128a66872c

commit_message:
Add support for federation service providers

Change-Id: I0c4c1ee77b0bbccd18af5b9b84a585a79f1a500c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/18/799118/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack.tests.unit import base from openstack.identity.v3 import service_provider IDENTIFIER = 'IDENTIFIER' EXAMPLE = { 'id': IDENTIFIER, 'description': 'An example description', 'is_enabled': True, 'auth_url': 'https://auth.example.com/v3/OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/idp/protocols/saml2/auth', 'sp_url': 'https://auth.example.com/Shibboleth.sso/SAML2/ECP' } class TestServiceProvider(base.TestCase): def test_basic(self): sot = service_provider.ServiceProvider() self.assertEqual('service_provider', sot.resource_key) self.assertEqual('service_providers', sot.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers', sot.base_path) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_create) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_fetch) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_commit) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_delete) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_list) self.assertTrue(sot.create_exclude_id_from_body) self.assertEqual('PATCH', sot.commit_method) self.assertEqual('PUT', sot.create_method) self.assertDictEqual( { 'id': 'id', 'limit': 'limit', 'marker': 'marker', 'is_enabled': 'enabled', }, sot._query_mapping._mapping) def test_make_it(self): sot = service_provider.ServiceProvider(**EXAMPLE) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['id'], sot.id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['id'], sot.name) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['description'], sot.description) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['is_enabled'], sot.is_enabled) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['auth_url'], sot.auth_url) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['sp_url'], sot.sp_url)

commit_message:
Provide a playbook example to deploy minions

This patch aims to provide an example of an Ansible
playbook which will take care of deploying an Undercloud
minion with the tripleo-operator-ansible project.

Change-Id: I889a929b25f1d3822757d88e3381952252ab0eb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-operator-ansible refs/changes/68/740268/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- ############################################################################### # Undercloud minions installation playbook # # Description: # This is a basic playbook to install undercloud minions on an already # provisioned system. # ############################################################################### - hosts: minions collections: - tripleo.operator vars: install_debug: true minion_hostname: 'minion.localdomain' minion_local_mtu: 1400 minion_local_interface: eth1 minion_enable_selinux: true # According to the doc it is highly recommended to leave this value set to true unless you are debugging an issue. tasks: - name: Set hostname hostname: name: "{{ minion_hostname }}" become: true - name: Configure tripleo repositories include_role: name: tripleo_repos - name: Ensure system is up to date yum: name: '*' state: latest register: packages_updated become: true - name: Reboot if necessary reboot: become: true when: packages_updated is changed - name: Install tripleoclient block: - name: install python tripleoclient yum: name: python2-tripleoclient state: installed become: true when: ansible_distribution_major_version|int <= 7 - name: install python3 tripleoclient package: name: python3-tripleoclient state: present become: true when: ansible_distribution_major_version|int >= 8 #5.4 - name: Copying the undercloud output file to the minion copy: src: ~/tripleo-undercloud-outputs.yaml dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/tripleo-undercloud-outputs.yaml" remote_src: false - name: Copying the undercloud password file to the minion copy: src: ~/tripleo-undercloud-passwords.yaml dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/tripleo-undercloud-passwords.yaml" remote_src: false #5.5 - name: copy: src: /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/cm-local-ca.pem dest: /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/cm-local-ca.pem remote_src: false - name: Copy sample minion.conf copy: src: /usr/share/python-tripleoclient/minion.conf.sample dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/minion.conf" remote_src: true - name: Configure minion.conf ini_file: path: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/minion.conf" section: "{{ item.section }}" option: "{{ item.option }}" value: "{{ item.value }}" loop: - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_debug', 'value': "{{ install_debug }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_local_mtu', 'value': "{{ minion_local_mtu }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_local_interface', 'value': "{{ minion_local_interface }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_enable_selinux', 'value': "{{ minion_enable_selinux }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'container_images_file', 'value': '/home/stack/containers-prepare-parameter.yaml'} # Example configuration copy/modification with config_template module # (https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-config_template) # # - name: Configure minion.conf # config_template: # src: /usr/share/python-tripleoclient/minion.conf.sample # dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/minion.conf" # remote_src: true # render_template: false # config_type: ini # config_overrides: # 'DEFAULT': # minion_debug: "{{ install_debug }}" # minion_local_mtu: "{{ minion_local_mtu }}" # minion_local_interface: "{{ minion_local_interface }}" # minion_enable_selinux: "{{ minion_enable_selinux }}" - name: Install minion include_role: name: tripleo_undercloud_minion_install vars: tripleo_minion_install_debug: "{{ install_debug }}"

commit_message:
Switch to proxy layer of the SDK for project

In previous change we switched to OpenStackModule. Now switch to usage
of the proxy layer directly. This also addresses possibility to create
subproject properly.
In the Keystone v3 it is not required to invoke create followed by
update - not sure why this was done fist.

Change-Id: I76d1e65160c5c83d7b2108cfc1e8f0662055783c
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/790095

commit_message:
Adding new parameter for the os_stack module

Which provides an option to skip the existing stack update.
By adding this parameter we are not changing any default behavior.

Change-Id: I34697db9a6c3b56720fdaed8dc4f06518f61afc9

commit_message:
ppc64le: Add altarch_excludes var for non x86 container builds

skydive is an x86 only container. This patch adds the a dict
called altarch_excludes that gets set only when building on non x86
hardware.

Change-Id: Iefbe9bc530a965d0651c5c4a4990f8e4d7e0b659
Co-Authored-By: Adam C Kimball <baha@astyr.net>

added_lines: altarch_excludes: dnf: None yum: None rocky: None

commit_message:
Add node validation function

Change-Id: I07afd3b41f1b5de65f458ecca4d4d29d48a16db3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/37/770037/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _initiate_node_validate(module, cloud, node): if _is_true(module.params['deploy']): if _is_false(node['deploy']): cloud.validate_machine(node['uuid'], True) module.exit_json(changed=True, msg="Node validate initiated.") return True if _initiate_node_validate(module, cloud, node): changed = True node = cloud.get_machine(node_id) else: module.fail_json(msg="Node not validated, cannot deploy.")

Add support for setting node boot device

Change-Id: I10477be33a23f99bfd2fad2e6ff5970da4ab6f1d

added_lines: def _set_node_boot_device(module, cloud, node): if _is_true(node['boot_interface']): cloud.baremetal.set_node_boot_device(node['uuid'], node['boot_interface'], False) module.exit_json(changed=True, msg="Boot device set") if _set_node_boot_device(module, cloud, node): changed = True node = cloud.get_machine(node_id)

commit_message:
Adding container engine to kolla_container_facts

Second part of patchset:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/799229/
in which was suggested to split patch into smaller ones.

This change adds container_engine variable to kolla_container_facts
module, this prepares module to be used with docker and podman as well
without further changes in roles.

Signed-off-by: Ivan Halomi <i.halomi@partner.samsung.com>
Co-authored-by: Martin Hiner <m.hiner@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: I9e8fa30646844ab4a288555f3aafdda345b3a118
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/83/862883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: container_engine: "{{ kolla_container_engine }}"

commit_message:
Add possibility to allocate FIP without attaching

Add a regular CRUD capabilities to the floating_ip module for allocating
it without attaching to anything. A wider set of checks should be
covered, but for the beginning this should be sufficient.

Change-Id: I002395cbb05b84b5d0613023bfcf535ed83afc16

commit_message:
Allow freeipa to be installed on CentOS9

Following tweaks so far:
- CentOS 9 is not using modules for freeipa
- haveged does not exist in C9
- conditionalized epel-release as seems to be unneeded on CS9

Tested by deploying freeipa on centos9 using the
freeipa-setup role + this patch

Change-Id: Ie86e2d1cf1465095f17fcf877457f337903e3508

Update the copyright year.

Use the datetime module and get the current year. To have always an
right copyright year.

commit_message:
Enable IPA debug logging

This change increases IPA debugging level and explicitly configures a
--forward-policy instead of letting IPA use whatever it wants.

Change-Id: I794427e004f77e8644b68fadb407c04ae2a1b130

added_lines: - name: Enable IPA server debug become: true community.general.ini_file: path: /etc/ipa/server.conf section: global option: debug value: True

quickstart.sh to install the version of the collections that's
compatible with the release being deployed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/844141

commit_message:
Condition ansible-collections-openstack version on release

In preparation for the coming breaking changes in
openstack-ansible-collections starting in Zed, this updates
quickstart.sh to install the version of the collections that's
compatible with the release being deployed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/844141

Change-Id: I014ef50269fc195f582d6d7e5cfe49294025ee30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/97/843497/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OS_COLLECTIONS="ansible-config_template tripleo-operator-ansible" # Install ansible-collections-openstack separately to account for different releases ACO_BRANCH=master if [[ $OPT_RELEASE =~ .*(train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby).* ]]; then ACO_BRANCH=stable/1.0.0 fi if [[ -d ~/src/opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack ]]; then # Install zuul-cloned repo pushd ~/src/opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack git checkout $ACO_BRANCH ansible-galaxy collection install --force . \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections popd else ansible-galaxy collection install --force \ git+https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack,$ACO_BRANCH \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections fi

subject: Adapt standalone-upgrade to run tripleo operator

commit_message:
Adapt standalone-upgrade to run tripleo operator

Update the standalone-upgrade role to be more similar to the
standalone role by relying the containers-prepare-parameter
and the tripleo-upgrade steps in the corresponding tripleo-
operator-ansible roles.

This patch also, splits the code into two parts, the one
corresponding to the containers preparation and the standalone
upgrade at such.

Change-Id: I16d959fdb41e74c254c74e06d77a9a6e526797ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/52/817552/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Gather ansible distribution setup: gather_subset: "!min,distribution" when: ansible_distribution is not defined - name: Set hostname hostname: name: "{{ standalone_hostname }}" become: true when: not enable_tls|default(false)|bool - name: set virtual-control-ip for TLS deployments set_fact: standalone_control_virtual_ip: "{{ undercloud_network_cidr|nthhost(210) }}" cacheable: true when: enable_tls|default(false)|bool - name: Add DNS and NTP server settings for TLS deployments become: true blockinfile: path: "{{ overcloud_templates_path }}/ci/environments/standalone-ipa.yaml" insertafter: " HAProxyExternalNetwork: ctlplane" block: | # Custom IPA params DnsServers: ["{{ subnode_1_ip }}"] NtpServer: "{{ job.standalone_ntp_servers|default(['clock.redhat.com']) }}" when: enable_tls|default(false)|bool # standalone upgrade params - name: Create the standalone params for upgrade template: src: "{{ standalone_config }}" dest: "{{ working_dir }}/standalone_parameters_upgrade.yaml" mode: 0755 - name: Remove settings that will be added with TLS lineinfile: path: "{{ working_dir }}/standalone_parameters_upgrade.yaml" regexp: "{{ item }}" state: absent backup: true with_items: - ' CloudName: 192.168.24.1' - ' CertmongerCA: local' - ' DnsServers: (.*)' when: enable_tls|default(false)|bool - name: Build and push containers into a local registry when: - build_container_images|default(false)|bool include_role: name: container-build vars: container_registry_namespace: "{{ docker_registry_namespace }}" container_tag: "{{ container_build_id }}" - name: Run container prepare legacy when: - release in ['queens', 'stein', 'train'] block: - name: Create container parameters script for upgrade template: src: "{{ standalone_container_prep_script }}" dest: "{{ working_dir }}/standalone-container-prep-upgrade.sh" mode: "0755" - commit_message:
redhat-common: enforce DIB_RELEASE

We've noticed that the centos element is using a DIB_RELEASE of "9"
for 9-stream, and the centos-minimal element is using "9-stream".

This creates confusion in elements where some package maps are being
written for "9", others for "9-stream", and sometimes matches work
because of alphabetical sorting but other times we use == matching and
it doesn't.

I think the best place to verify this is probably in a early element
of redhat-common, which is included by all these elements.  This way
we can ensure that all these paths (that are not tested together) at
least agree on the DIB_RELEASE tags.

Change-Id: Ieedfb1d187572f63a98844116e4882fb8739ffee

commit_message:
Mellanox NICs' ifcfg-scripts should not be removed when no CONFIG change exists

os-net-config is triggering reconfiguration/flapping of
mellanox nics even when there are no changes in the NIC configs.
Added check to NOT remove ifcfg-* scripts for Mellonox NICs when
DPDK/Bond is enabled

Resolves: rhbz#2131248
Change-Id: Ida0c78ba7784d452165999af4dd955b0129cfdaf

commit_message:
[RBAC] Return 404 if share is inaccessible

When a user is prevented from listing a non-public
share, the API service would return a 403 Forbidden.
This isn't consistent with the API SIG's guidance
on resources restricted by virtue of RBAC policy since
users with malicious intent may use the signal to
mean that the resource exists.

Depends-On: I27fdd7dfffeb15965b66dbb3f6b1568c11ff9ad4
Change-Id: I7e05dcb343c932cc7fec8d395919053d0a1801ce
Closes-Bug: #1901210

commit_message:
Define queues at project level

Defining queues at project.pipeline level was deprecated in release
4.1.0 of Zuul [1] and support for it will (probably) be dropped in
release 7.0.0. [2][3]

This patch isn't a clean cherry-pick since
we're including a bugfix for mysql-8 which is needed
by the unit tests running in the requirements check
job. We've to club these changes because the requirements
job is a voting job. [4]

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/latest/releasenotes.html#relnotes-4-1-0-deprecation-notes
[2] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-May/028603.html
[3] https://lists.zuul-ci.org/pipermail/zuul-discuss/2022-May/001801.html
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/836342

Signed-off-by: Eduardo Santos <eduardo.experimental@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ife023187f307f1190d5e76daf644db0b5cd55d38

commit_message:
[CI] Pin tempest plugin and scenario test image

Tempest is pinned to a 26.1.0 on this stable
branch [1]. manila-tempest-plugin in Zed requires a newer
tempest release [2] than this one. So, pin
manila-tempest-plugin as well to a version that can still
work with the pinned version of tempest.

Also, manila's test image (built from manila-image-elements)
is based off of Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy Jellyfish) in the Zed
release; we don't need that image to be used to test this
stable branch and we could use an older version (based on
Ubuntu 20.04 - Focal Fossa) that requires less memory/CPU [3]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/838051
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/849995
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/846061

Change-Id: Ic7213030dd433b765d5a815d8a31aee01b09da1c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d68e16fb89c63828b4a6ffc8a95493eefff4baff)

subject: Create entry for empty groups in inventory_rolemap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-20 11:46:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/6567d0e5722a01440725ed78415899aa8dca68ba', 'message': 'Create entry for empty groups in inventory_rolemap

When a group is a child of another group then the child groups role mappings
are added to the parent group role mappings. This which fails with a

commit_message:
Create entry for empty groups in inventory_rolemap

When a group is a child of another group then the child groups role mappings
are added to the parent group role mappings. This which fails with a
KeyError when the child is an empty group as no mapping is created.

Closes-bug: #1994081
Related: rhbz#2089512
Change-Id: I05f4989b0f14d56d3c33f91b3cccb85b729987cb

commit_message:
Make integration tests stop on first failure

This should save us some time and decrease the server load. If a single
test failed, we already know the patch is bad (or the tests need to be
rerun) so it makes no sense to execute the rest of the tests on the
gate.

Change-Id: Ic56d5e192487d444afd0cdf0bce5e1a691ba087c

Selenium read data faster than the data are loaded.
Added wait until element is visible.

commit_message:
Drop py2 and mysql bits from bindep

py2 has been deprecated couple of years ago and is not part of PTI
Moreover modern operating systems are not capable of installing it

mysql can be safely replaced with mariadb for consistency with rpm

Change-Id: I0f01814849937f1df763e9118a724c0361d9e487

commit_message:
Fix molecule jobs broken with latest cryptography

Pin cryptography to < 37.0.0[1].

Also, changes tripleo_keystone_resources role to use
centos:stream9 image.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/7126

Closes-Bug: #1995608
Change-Id: I6852de27f68f4dcf2cac44a80b3a491db1996d9f

deleted_lines: import ironic_inspector_client def get_ironic_inspector_client(self): """Return the ironic inspector client. This method will return a client object using the legacy library. Upon the creation of a successful client creation, the client object will be stored in the `self.client_cache object`, should this method be called more than once, the cached object will automatically return, resulting in fewer authentications and faster API interactions. :returns: Object """ if 'ironic_inspector_client' in self.client_cache: return self.client_cache['ironic_inspector_client'] else: self.client_cache['ironic_inspector_client'] = \ ironic_inspector_client.ClientV1(session=self.sess) return self.client_cache['ironic_inspector_client'] def return_introspected_node_data(self, node_id): """Return baremetal data from the ironic inspector. :param node_id: Node UUID :type node_id: String :returns: Object """ client = self.get_ironic_inspector_client() return client.get_data(node_id=node_id)

commit_message:
WIP - Refactoring preflight checks and validations

The goal of this review is to refactor the preflight checks
for undercloud, tripleo and overcloud deploy in order to
centralized all those checks into a common place in tripleo-validations.
The major gain of this approach is:
* allow operators to run preflight checks on demmand, outside of the
  tripleo CLI deploy command with the Validation Framework binary.
* the checks will be logged on the fs and the history could be retrieved
* the checks sometimes overlap existing validations, so converging those will
  avoid duplication.

Change-Id: I165eb65c54a2767b916d947251771b5548cb7071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/35/863535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2022 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import logging import subprocess import sys from osc_lib.i18n import _ from oslo_config import cfg from tripleoclient import constants from tripleoclient import utils class FailedValidation(Exception): pass CONF = cfg.CONF # We need 8 GB, leave a little room for variation in what 8 GB means on # different platforms. REQUIRED_MB = 7 LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".UndercloudSetup") def _run_live_command(args, env=None, name=None, cwd=None, wait=True): """Run the command defined by args, env and cwd Either returns the process handler or runs the process asynchronously so the output can be logged while the process is still running. """ if name is None: name = args[0] process = subprocess.Popen(args, env=env, cwd=cwd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, universal_newlines=True) if not wait: return process while True: line = process.stdout.readline() if line: LOG.info(line.rstrip()) if line == '' and process.poll() is not None: break if process.returncode != 0: message = '%s failed. See log for details.' % name LOG.error(message) raise RuntimeError(message) def _run_validations(playbooks=[], inventory='undercloud', extra_args=None): """Run tripleo-validations playbook """ args = ['validation', 'run', '-i', inventory, '--validation', ','.join(playbooks), '--extra-vars', extra_args] _run_live_command(args) def _checking_status(item): LOG.info(_('Checking %s...') % item) def undercloud_checks(verbose_level, upgrade=False, net_config_yaml=None): # Fetch configuration and use its log file param to add logging to a file utils.load_config(CONF, constants.UNDERCLOUD_CONF_PATH) utils.configure_logging(LOG, verbose_level, CONF['undercloud_log_file']) # data = {opt.name: CONF[opt.name] for opt in _opts} try: _checking_status('Hostname') _run_validations(['check-uc-hostname']) _checking_status('Memory') _run_validations(['check-ram'], extra_args='minimal_ram_gb='.format(REQUIRED_MB)) _checking_status('Disk space') if upgrade: _run_validations( constants.DEPLOY_ANSIBLE_ACTIONS['preflight-upgrade']) else: _run_validations( constants.DEPLOY_ANSIBLE_ACTIONS['preflight-deploy']) _checking_status('Sysctl') _run_validations(['undercloud_sysctl']) _checking_status('Password file') #TODO: handle config file pass _run_validations(['validate_passwords_file']) _checking_status('Deprecated now invalid options') _validate_deprecetad_now_invalid_parameters() # Heat templates validations if CONF.get('custom_env_files'): _checking_status('Custom env file') _validate_env_files_paths() # Networking validations _checking_status('Networking values') _validate_value_formats() _check_routed_networks_enabled_if_multiple_subnets_defined() _check_all_or_no_subnets_use_dns_nameservers() for subnet in CONF.subnets: s = CONF.get(subnet) _checking_status('Subnet "%s" is in CIDR' % subnet) _validate_in_cidr(s, subnet) _checking_status('DHCP range is in subnet "%s"' % subnet) _validate_dhcp_range(s, subnet) _checking_status('Inspection range for subnet "%s"' % subnet) _validate_inspection_range(s) _validate_dnsnameservers(s) _checking_status('IP addresses') _validate_ips() _checking_status('Network interfaces') _validate_interface_exists() _checking_status('Provisioning IP change') _validate_no_ip_change(net_config_yaml) _checking_status('Architecture') _validate_architecure_options() except KeyError as e: LOG.error(_('Key error in configuration: {error}\n' 'Value is missing in configuration.').format(error=e)) sys.exit(1) except FailedValidation as e: LOG.error(_('An error occurred during configuration ' 'validation, please check your host ' 'configuration and try again.\nError ' 'message: {error}').format(error=e)) sys.exit(1) except RuntimeError as e: LOG.error(_('An error occurred during configuration ' 'validation, please check your host ' 'configuration and try again. Error ' 'message: {error}').format(error=e)) sys.exit(1)

commit_message:
Release octavia for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to octavia since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 8.0.1..8abf181
1028bc24 Fix update/delete listener CA/CRL error
a25076a1 Fix HealthMonitorToErrorOnRevertTask revert method
8a7ece8a Fix potential race conditions on update requests in the v2 worker
ca66aac3 Fix duplicate object error messages
d0adca9a Set sensible nf_conntrack_max value in amphora
1e5c20c2 Correct format of release note
5d45e56b Fix disabled UDP pools
6c52fd0e Validate L7Rule value and cookie name
a870525d Fix new pylint issues
4503bd27 Reject invalid whitespace in HM url_path value
89fe4754 Remove unneeded sudo in lvs-masquerade.sh
2b2494d7 Fix compile_amphora_details when using UDP listeners
5d332357 Deny the creation of L7Policies for HTTPS/TCP/UDP listeners
3ee4acb6 Fix AttributeError in exception handler
97ac37bc Save the HAProxy state outside of its systemd unit
7bee4bdb Disabling octavia-grenade job in stable/wallaby
bf73410f Restart rsyslog from cloud-init
f0720d67 Pass timeout_dict to _get_haproxy_versions
3f134a29 Fix Amphora RSyslog configuration for TCP failover
9d93dc50 Use centos amphora image in the FIPS jobs
d7c25c3e Add fips jobs
2500987d Fix ipv6 interface configuration
a0196a64 Fix unplugging member ports
ce9a4356 Fix amphora-agent elements for RHEL9
82665fed Optimize DB object to provider dict conversions
b4806a83 Add keepalive for redis-based taskflow boards
0b013158 Fix detection of member operating status DRAIN
d14cc33b Fix amphora build in CentOS Stream 9
55bce250 Preserve haproxy server states during reloads
ba45c0b7 Replace md5 for fips
d7a20cf4 Update scripts to use fips allowed algorithms
1efeb8d5 Fix nft command line with negative priority values

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>

Fix the anaconda deploy for the ISO mounted

Fix the anaconda deploy for the ISO mounted
on a webserver.

Story: 2010322
Task: 46429

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/97/859397/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(TheJulia): Files should have been caught almost exclusively # before with the Content-Length check. # When the ISO is mounted and the webserver mount point url is # checked here, it has both 'Content-Length' and 'Content-Type' # due to which it always returns False. Hence switched the conditions. if ('Content-Type' in headers and str(headers['Content-Type']).startswith('text')): LOG.debug('Evaluated %(url)s to determine if it is a URL to a path ' 'or a file. A Content-Type header was returned with a text ' 'content, which suggests a file list was returned.', {'url': image_source}) return True
deleted_lines: if ('Content-Type' in headers and str(headers['Content-Type']).startswith('text') and 'Content-Length' not in headers): LOG.debug('Evaluated %(url)s to determine if it is a URL to a path ' 'or a file. A Content-Type header was returned with a text ' 'content, which suggests a file list was returned.', {'url': image_source}) return True # NOTE(TheJulia): Files should have been caught almost exclusively # before with the Content-Length check.

commit_message:
Define queues at project level

Defining queues at project.pipeline level was deprecated in release
4.1.0 of Zuul [1] and support for it will (probably) be dropped in
release 7.0.0. [2][3]

This patch isn't a clean cherry-pick since
we're including a bugfix for mysql-8 which is needed
by the unit tests running in the requirements check
job. We've to club these changes because the requirements
job is a voting job. [4]

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/latest/releasenotes.html#relnotes-4-1-0-deprecation-notes
[2] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-May/028603.html
[3] https://lists.zuul-ci.org/pipermail/zuul-discuss/2022-May/001801.html
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/836342

Signed-off-by: Eduardo Santos <eduardo.experimental@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ife023187f307f1190d5e76daf644db0b5cd55d38
(cherry picked from commit 441d6470ca3a24f29f60494ed31755d2842b2fa3)
(cherry picked from commit ad6874141de3637c2200315e95f51242b070b0e7)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-03 15:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/ssh_migrations.py', 'charmhelpers/fetch/ubuntu.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/ha/utils.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/utils.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/hahelpers/cluster.py', 'charmhelpers/core/host.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/ip.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/templates/haproxy.cfg', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/vaultlocker.py', 'charmhelpers/core/unitdata.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/charmsupport/nrpe.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/network/ip.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller/commit/5a20c435e511d1c6a133b293e8aa3d4c91f65b10', 'message': "ch-sync: IndentityServiceContext app data fixes

The IdentityServiceContext was recently updated to add the application
data bag. Unfortunately, they keystone charm uses both the regular
relation data primarily, but the updates for endpoints are on both the
application database and the regular relation data. The
IdentityServiceContext used the app data bag exclusively if there were
any keys available, which leads to it ignoring the existing relation
data entirely; this results in 'identity relation not ready' with
missing data items.

charm-helpers is patched at [1] to solve the issue and this is a
charm-helpers sync that includes that patch.  This changes the
functionality of the IdentityServiceContext so that it preferentially
selects keys from the application data bag unless they are None, in
which case it tries for those keys on the existing relation data. e.g.
it will stitch the two relations together with the app data bag taking
priority. This allows the nova-cloud-controller charm to correctly
access the identity relation data and form a complete context.

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/746

Change-Id: Ic868213c6bb42bc2a28ad25a2f7344a28ab9f04d
"}]
commit_message:
ch-sync: IndentityServiceContext app data fixes

The IdentityServiceContext was recently updated to add the application
data bag. Unfortunately, they keystone charm uses both the regular
relation data primarily, but the updates for endpoints are on both the
application database and the regular relation data. The
IdentityServiceContext used the app data bag exclusively if there were
any keys available, which leads to it ignoring the existing relation
data entirely; this results in 'identity relation not ready' with
missing data items.

charm-helpers is patched at [1] to solve the issue and this is a
charm-helpers sync that includes that patch.  This changes the
functionality of the IdentityServiceContext so that it preferentially
selects keys from the application data bag unless they are None, in
which case it tries for those keys on the existing relation data. e.g.
it will stitch the two relations together with the app data bag taking
priority. This allows the nova-cloud-controller charm to correctly
access the identity relation data and form a complete context.

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/746

Change-Id: Ic868213c6bb42bc2a28ad25a2f7344a28ab9f04d

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Remove impish bundles as EOL.
Make yoga voting as the charm on stable/yoga should support yoga.

Change-Id: Ia498b3fcbb22ad31b4a58b8c3979df5a1067e2b2

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Remove impish bundle as EOL.

Change-Id: I332d0d90d9495254b5ee378c51090ec0533d8ce6

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Change-Id: I7622b574e472aad69314ead05aaec321b3f02fa6

commit_message:
Add list_opts() function and define entry point

This patch makes it possible to use oslo-config-generator, which was not
possible without the correct oslo.config entry point.

Change-Id: I5174fb7a8e10b2f8a833bca5c54b4d05b0e91ad0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-bgp-agent refs/changes/11/863311/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: oslo.config.opts = ovnbgpagent = ovn_bgp_agent.config:list_opts

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Remove impish bundle.
Add libpq-dev for py310 test (pg_config required for install)

Change-Id: I1f3b68ef2cbd7423078959d633c60800e6f2b937

Add missing overlays

Changes:
- Add jammy-zed.yaml.j2
- Add kinetic-zed.yaml.j2
- Drop unused overlays (symlinks to ha.j2)
- Drop 'source' key from mysql-innodb-cluster and rabbitmq-server

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Also remove impish as EOL, and make jammy-yoga voting.

Change-Id: Ifd111d333af00001a812fe5c4ecffe96ce7ca0c3

commit_message:
Add replace location test

Replacing locations is a little strange, in that you "replace" the
whole list of locations, but only metadata for existing locations
is allowed, but outside the JSON PATCH checking. This adds a test
that probes the boundaries of that and makes sure we are allowed
(and disallowed) the right operations.

Change-Id: I753872656b990741ababfbdd64893746493b5e13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/90/861390/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(danms): This fails with an invalid JSON pointer. Should this work? @decorators.idempotent_id('bf6e0009-c039-4884-b498-db074caadb10') def test_replace_location(self): image = self.test_set_multiple_locations() expected_original_loc = image['locations'][0] new_loc = {'metadata': {'date': '2015-10-15'}, 'url': '%s#new3' % CONF.image.http_image} self.client.update_image(image['id'], [ dict(replace='/locations/1/url', value=new_loc['url'])]) # The image should now have two locations and the last one # (locations are ordered) should have the new URL. The # first one should be unchanged from the original. image = self.client.show_image(image['id']) self.assertEqual(2, len(image['locations']), 'Image should have two locations but has %i' % ( len(image['locations']))) self.assertEqual(new_loc['url'], image['locations'][1]['url']) self.assertEqual(expected_original_loc['url'], image['locations'][0]['url'])

commit_message:
Check if Zuul API is reachable before try pulling logs

The logscraper service when Zuul API is down, it is raise an
exception and the service is going to stop, but the logscraper
service is controlled by systemd, which is periodically restarting
the service.
This patch is checking if the Zuul API is reachable before pull,
so it should not raise an exception and service should be running
for long time.

Change-Id: Idbe9b2024d0d049df26cf857a5309c3b9e42b80e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ci-log-processing refs/changes/15/862615/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_zuul_host_up(url, verify=True): try: resp = requests_get(url, verify) return resp.status_code < 400 except requests.exceptions.HTTPError: logging.warning("Zuul host is not available!") if not is_zuul_host_up(zuul_api_url, validate_ca): logging.warning("Zuul seems not to be reachable. " "Postponing pulling logs...") continue

commit_message:
Fix the condition for the cinder resource.

The disk must be also in status available not only be created.

Change-Id: I9d69e087bd8ab7fc5a1d34f94ca4882b06117829
(cherry picked from commit 81befed97a90c1f04a1f95663a99e20814c00776)
(cherry picked from commit 42d084282765d8d368cfc540a68acc7ec65b6025)

added_lines: ## The cinder resource must be created and available to be attach VOL_STATUS=$(openstack volume show ${CINDER_VOL_ID} -f value -c status) if [[ ${VOL_STATUS} == "available" ]]; then echo "The volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID} successfully created and available"
deleted_lines: openstack volume list -f value -c ID | grep -q ${CINDER_VOL_ID} if [[ ${?} -eq 0 ]]; then echo "The volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID} successfully created"

commit_message:
Fix host:port handling

When we check the EC2 signature without the port part of the host value
received, we should properly split host:port. Keep in mind the splitting
should work for values like [fc00::]:123 too.

Change-Id: I1d90dfcea3568e2a9b22069daa428ea6a2a38bd6
Closes-Bug: #1988168
(cherry picked from commit 6c35b366e3c8c6d7f47471b93f5315582301c5ef)
(cherry picked from commit d39790ac4e9dc25af09cdddc6217e36bacbc2bb1)
(cherry picked from commit 0bb9cdee71805af1a7cb0a7db110b336eae5da1e)
(cherry picked from commit aa50b963cce20a76db0c4834b3716d3658c784af)
(cherry picked from commit fe837d87c949f6a2347cf79d81b66214f0a449b3)
(cherry picked from commit 1ab860a08e527ca9e0c82a49fbf004d415fec991)

Remove unicode literal from code

All strings are considered as unicode literal string from Python 3.

Closes bug: #1995548

commit_message:
[neutron] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I164cd2e7f995253b83d013fb0cf223f953f333d9

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Iab06113f4e9347aff6e9de094781703043eb0fe7
'}]
commit_message:
[manila] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Iab06113f4e9347aff6e9de094781703043eb0fe7

commit_message:
Upload image chunks in parallel to Swift

PUT operation for images is slow due to synchronous chunks uploading.
To speed up this operation, the patch uses a `ThreadPoolExecutor`
to split the chunk to be uploaded.

This only affects only the Swift backend.

Depends-On: Ie605675e919263e38262a322958479e821a7c98c
Change-Id: I628612d3491e199c3756c013a10de0ee48033b09

commit_message:
Fix the condition for the cinder resource.

The disk must be also in status available not only be created.

Change-Id: I9d69e087bd8ab7fc5a1d34f94ca4882b06117829
(cherry picked from commit 81befed97a90c1f04a1f95663a99e20814c00776)

deleted_lines: openstack volume list -f value -c ID | grep -q ${CINDER_VOL_ID} if [[ ${?} -eq 0 ]]; then echo "The volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID} successfully created"

commit_message:
Bulk creation of OpenStack SG rules

Change-Id: Ieb2e70e2e67e0f8647cbb7e6b6ae7b546098646a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/31/863431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright (c) 2022, Pokoradi Balazs <pokoradi.1899@gmail.com> # GNU General Public License v3.0+ (see COPYING or https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt) DOCUMENTATION = """ --- module: security_group_rules short_description: Bulk creation of rules from an existing security group author: Balazs Pokoradi (@pb1899) description: - Add or remove rules from an existing security group (works only if all rules are for the same group). Relies on the bulk creation of rules functionality in the OpenStack SDK and the security_group_rule module. NB that the module uses a single API call to bulk create the rules however, deleting rules needs to be done via individual API calls for each rule, ie a broken execution may result in a state where certain rules are deleted from the security group whilst others not yet. The recommended use case for this module is the bulk creation of rules, which can significantly speed up the creation of OpenStack projects with Ansible. options: security_group: description: - Name or ID of the security group required: false default: "default" type: str project: description: - Unique name or ID of the project. required: false type: str secgroup_rules: description: - List of SG rules declared in the playbook/inventory - Each rule is a dictionary. type: list elements: dict suboptions: protocol: description: - IP protocols ANY TCP UDP ICMP and others, also number in range 0-255 type: str port_range_min: description: - Starting port type: int port_range_max: description: - Ending port type: int remote_ip_prefix: description: - Source IP address(es) in CIDR notation (exclusive with remote_group and remote_ip_prefix) type: str remote_ip_prefixes: description: - List of source IP address(es) in CIDR notation (exclusive with remote_group and remote_ip_prefix) type: list elements: str aliases: [prefixes] remote_group: description: - Name or ID of the Security group to link (exclusive with remote_ip_prefix/remote_ip_prefixes) type: str ether_type: description: - Must be IPv4 or IPv6, and addresses represented in CIDR must match the ingress or egress rules. Not all providers support IPv6. choices: ["IPv4", "IPv6"] default: IPv4 type: str aliases: [ethertype] direction: description: - The direction in which the security group rule is applied. Not all providers support egress. choices: ["egress", "ingress"] default: ingress type: str state: description: - Should the resource be present or absent. choices: [present, absent] default: present type: str description: required: false description: - Description of the rule. type: str requirements: - "python >= 3.6" - "openstacksdk" extends_documentation_fragment: - openstack.cloud.openstack """ EXAMPLES = """ - name: Default firewall rules security_group_rules: cloud: "overcloud" security_group: default project: '{{ inventory_hostname }}' secgroup_rules: - protocol: udp ethertype: IPv6 direction: ingress port_range_min: 547 port_range_max: 547 - protocol: tcp ethertype: IPv4 direction: ingress port_range_min: 22 port_range_max: 22 prefixes: - 10.30.8.43/32 - 10.30.8.113/32 - 10.30.145.52/32 """ RETURN = """ security_group_rules: description: List of SG rules declared in the playbook/inventory elements: dict type: list returned: always contains: id: description: Unique rule UUID. type: str returned: state == present rule: description: Representation of the security group rule type: dict returned: when I(state) is present contains: created_at: description: Timestamp when the resource was created type: str returned: always description: description: Description of the resource type: str returned: always direction: description: The direction in which the security group rule is applied. type: str sample: 'egress' returned: always ether_type: description: Either IPv4 or IPv6 type: str returned: always id: description: Unique rule UUID. type: str returned: always name: description: Name of the resource. type: str returned: always port_range_max: description: The maximum port number in the range that is matched by the security group rule. type: int sample: 8000 returned: always port_range_min: description: The minimum port number in the range that is matched by the security group rule. type: int sample: 8000 returned: always project_id: description: ID of the project the resource belongs to. type: str returned: always protocol: description: The protocol that is matched by the security group rule. type: str sample: 'tcp' returned: always remote_address_group_id: description: The remote address group ID to be associated with this security group rule. type: str sample: '0.0.0.0/0' returned: always remote_group_id: description: The remote security group ID to be associated with this security group rule. type: str sample: '0.0.0.0/0' returned: always remote_ip_prefix: description: The remote IP prefix to be associated with this security group rule. type: str sample: '0.0.0.0/0' returned: always revision_number: description: Revision number type: int sample: 0 returned: always security_group_id: description: The security group ID to associate with this security group rule. type: str returned: always tags: description: Tags associated with resource. type: list elements: str returned: always tenant_id: description: ID of the project the resource belongs to. Deprecated. type: str returned: always updated_at: description: Timestamp when the security group rule was last updated. type: str returned: always """ from ansible_collections.openstack.cloud.plugins.module_utils.openstack import ( OpenStackModule, ) security_group_rule = dict( protocol=dict(), port_range_min=dict(type="int"), port_range_max=dict(type="int"), remote_ip_prefix=dict(), remote_ip_prefixes=dict(type="list", elements="str", aliases=["prefixes"]), remote_group=dict(), ether_type=dict(default="IPv4", choices=["IPv4", "IPv6"], aliases=["ethertype"]), direction=dict(default="ingress", choices=["egress", "ingress"]), state=dict(default="present", choices=["absent", "present"]), description=dict(), ) class SecurityGroupRulesModule(OpenStackModule): argument_spec = dict( secgroup_rules=dict(type="list", elements="dict", options=security_group_rule), security_group=dict(default="default"), project=dict(), ) # module_kwargs = dict( # mutually_exclusive=[ # ["remote_ip_prefix", "remote_group"], # ["remote_ip_prefixes", "remote_group"], # ["remote_ip_prefixes", "remote_ip_prefix"], # ] # ) def _expand_prefixes(self, list_of_rules): """ for the same type of rules, it's not necessary to define each rule in details, just use the 'prefixes' list for the IP addresses/CIDR ranges :returns: each rule detailed as per the security_group_rule module's specification """ rules_with_ip_prefixes_expanded = [] rules_with_ip_prefixes = [] for r in list_of_rules: if r.get("prefixes"): for prefix in r.get("prefixes"): new_rule = r.copy() new_rule["remote_ip_prefix"] = prefix del new_rule["prefixes"] rules_with_ip_prefixes.append(new_rule) else: rules_with_ip_prefixes_expanded.append(r) rules_with_ip_prefixes_expanded.extend(rules_with_ip_prefixes) return rules_with_ip_prefixes_expanded def _find_existing_rule(self, rule_to_create, secgroup): """ Find a rule in the group that matches the module parameters. :returns: The matching rule dict, or None if no matches. """ for rule in secgroup["security_group_rules"]: if rule["ethertype"] != rule_to_create["ethertype"]: continue if rule["direction"] != rule_to_create["direction"]: continue protocol_condition1 = rule["protocol"] == rule_to_create["protocol"] protocol_condition2 = ( rule["protocol"] == "ipv6-icmp" and rule_to_create["protocol"] == "icmp" and rule_to_create["ethertype"] == "IPv6" ) if not (protocol_condition1 or protocol_condition2): continue ports_condition1 = ( rule_to_create["port_range_min"] and rule_to_create["port_range_max"] ) ports_condition2 = ( rule_to_create["port_range_min"] is None and rule_to_create["port_range_max"] is None ) if ports_condition1 or ports_condition2: if ( rule_to_create["port_range_min"] != rule["port_range_min"] or rule_to_create["port_range_max"] != rule["port_range_max"] ): continue elif rule_to_create.get("remote_ip_prefix") and rule.get( "remote_ip_prefix" ): if rule["remote_ip_prefix"] == rule_to_create["remote_ip_prefix"]: return rule else: return rule return None def _deduplicate_rules(self, rules): # OpenStack SG doesn't allow duplicate rules rules_deduped = [] for data in rules: if data not in rules_deduped: rules_deduped.append(data) return rules_deduped def _build_kwargs(self, project, security_group, secgroup_rules): project_name_or_id = self.params["project"] security_group = self.params["security_group"] project = None if project_name_or_id: project = self.conn.identity.find_project( project_name_or_id, ignore_missing=False ) filters = {} if project: filters = {"project_id": project.id} secgroup = self.conn.network.find_security_group( security_group, ignore_missing=False, **filters ) kwargs = self.params["secgroup_rules"].copy() for k in kwargs: k["security_group_id"] = secgroup.id k["project_id"] = project.id state = k.get("state") if not state: k["state"] = "present" remote_group_name_or_id = k.get("remote_group") protocol = k.get("protocol") if not protocol: k["protocol"] = "tcp" port_range_min = k.get("port_range_min") if not port_range_min: k["port_range_min"] = None port_range_max = k.get("port_range_max") if not port_range_max: k["port_range_max"] = None remote_group = None if remote_group_name_or_id: remote_group = self.conn.network.find_security_group( remote_group_name_or_id, ignore_missing=False, filters=filters ) k["remote_group_id"] = remote_group.id rules_list = self._expand_prefixes(kwargs) # the inventory may have duplicate rules rules_deduped = self._deduplicate_rules(rules_list) if secgroup and len(secgroup["security_group_rules"]) > 0: rules_to_create = [ r for r in rules_deduped if r["state"] == "present" and not self._find_existing_rule(r, secgroup) ] rules_to_delete = [] for r in rules_deduped: rule_exists = self._find_existing_rule(r, secgroup) if r["state"] == "absent" and rule_exists: r["id"] = rule_exists["id"] rules_to_delete.append(r) else: rules_to_create = None rules_to_delete = None return rules_to_create, rules_to_delete def run(self): project = self.params["project"] security_group = self.params["security_group"] secgroup_rules = self.params["secgroup_rules"] rules_to_create, rules_to_delete = self._build_kwargs( project, security_group, secgroup_rules ) result = {"changed": False, "msg": ""} if len(rules_to_delete) > 0: for rule in rules_to_delete: try: self.conn.network.delete_security_group_rule(rule) result["changed"] = True result["msg"] = f"Deleted {len(rules_to_delete)} rule(s)" except Exception as e: result["msg"] = f"Failed to delete the rules, error: {e}" self.fail_json(**result) if len(rules_to_create) > 0: try: self.conn.network.create_security_group_rules(rules_to_create) result["changed"] = True result["msg"] = ( result["msg"] + ";" + f"Created {len(rules_to_create)} rule(s)" ) except Exception as e: result["msg"] = f"Failed to create the rules, error: {e}" self.fail_json(**result) self.exit_json(**result) def main(): module = SecurityGroupRulesModule() module() if __name__ == "__main__": main()

added_lines: def test_unshelve_spawn_fails_cleanup_instance_image_ref(self): """Tests error handling when a instance fails to unshelve and makes sure to revert instance.image_ref to the initial value instead of keeping the one of shelved image https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1934094 """ instance = self._create_fake_instance_obj() # TODO(pslestang) to uncomment when bug 1934094 is fixed # initial_image_ref = instance.image_ref fake_spec = objects.RequestSpec() shelved_image = {'id': uuids.image_id} with mock.patch.object(self.compute.driver, 'spawn', side_effect=test.TestingException('Spawn Failed')): self.assertRaises(test.TestingException, self.compute.unshelve_instance, self.context, instance, image=shelved_image, filter_properties={}, node='fake-node', request_spec=fake_spec, accel_uuids=[]) # FIXME(pslestang) Until bug 1934094 is fixed # The instance.image_ref is set to shelved_image.id but should be # equal to initial_image_ref self.assertEqual(instance.image_ref, shelved_image['id'])

subject: Release manila for stable/wallaby
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-28 08:56:13.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/wallaby/manila.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/6f0ab90e58c4c1f11856e617514acd3210e1b3e2', 'message': "Release manila for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to manila since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 12.1.2..3d844d6bc

da7101f17 Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing
7102626e1 [CI] Install dependencies for docs target

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ic53040abc7a77c4f00b04ed57a6abe660a6ff400

commit_message:
Release manila for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to manila since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 12.1.2..3d844d6bc
3d844d6bc [Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules
da7101f17 Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing
7102626e1 [CI] Install dependencies for docs target

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ic53040abc7a77c4f00b04ed57a6abe660a6ff400

Elsewhere.

commit_message:
Updating Zuul CI jobs for os-net-config repo

Updated the Zuul CI layout.yaml to replace the gate job
‘openstack-tox-pep8’ with the check job
‘tripleo-ci-centos-9-content-provider’ (which has a
dependency on ‘openstack-tox-pep8’ in the os-net-config repo CI)

Change-Id: I64f3ba6d086bb8814b8ea6e6b3b403c532c42e99

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4fb9c62e23cdc28e69b7e51616ab81b18f65d4bc

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iee5cd41d3390f4fe872715949b8091b3de0b46f9

commit_message:
Skip removal of Mellanox NICs' ifcfg-* scripts

os-net-config is triggering reconfiguration/flapping of
mellanox nics even when there are no changes in the NIC configs.
Added check to NOT remove ifcfg-* scripts for Mellonox NICs when
DPDK/Bond is enabled

Change-Id: If26bbdf1a4c286f24fa0b37e555271af05d9cb03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/79/861079/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: logger.info('removing existing ifcfg script: %s' % ifname) if not self.noop and ( not utils.is_mellanox_interface(ifname) ): if not self.noop and ( not utils.is_mellanox_interface(ifname) ):
deleted_lines: if not self.noop: if not self.noop:

subject: Use daemon property instead of setDaemon method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-25 06:51:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/e2032435ba9b81cb2fb02096cd2d475677ef6de7', 'message': 'Use daemon property instead of setDaemon method

The setDaemon method of the threading.Thread was deprecated
in Python 3.10 (*).
Replace the setDaemon method with the daemon property.

*: https://docs.python.org/3.10/library/threading.html#threading.Thread.setDaemon

Change-Id: Id4b6df45ba4741e410692df7bd11db3f56f00f45
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-10-15 08:05:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/6e6799c6b289e04b1adb3f39a1213d068e04bc6d', 'message': 'Use daemon property instead of setDaemon method

The setDaemon method of the threading.Thread was deprecated
in Python 3.10 (*).
Replace the setDaemon method with the daemon property.

*: https://docs.python.org/3.10/library/threading.html#threading.Thread.setDaemon

commit_message:
Use daemon property instead of setDaemon method

The setDaemon method of the threading.Thread was deprecated
in Python 3.10 (*).
Replace the setDaemon method with the daemon property.

*: https://docs.python.org/3.10/library/threading.html#threading.Thread.setDaemon

Change-Id: Id4b6df45ba4741e410692df7bd11db3f56f00f45
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Improve map_merge logging

Templates can be complex and contain multiple instances of
map_merges. Debugging this can be complex, so this change
aims to improve the mapping and help users determine where
the problem has occured.

With this change, instead of just saying an error occured,
we will now return the object that the error occurred with
and a note about it's type. This will allow for quick
identification of what the problem was.

Change-Id: I8661ae43fb86a842096e5ad86a54839feac04839

commit_message:
Improve map_merge logging

Templates can be complex and contain multiple instances of
map_merges. Debugging this can be complex, so this change
aims to improve the mapping and help users determine where
the problem has occured.

With this change, instead of just saying an error occured,
we will now return the object that the error occurred with
and a note about it's type. This will allow for quick
identification of what the problem was.

Change-Id: I70502525f49298bf5c395d9a68c4564fd724a628

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7524ae1dbcef1d88978370674541a777306cd598
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/94/863394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/zed}

commit_message:
Use ingress-public for WSGI configuration

ingress-internal is an optional relation so use ingress-public
data when configuring WSGI script aliases.

Change-Id: Ic99956549e01f3a2b30b352bf61adac3bd3807fd

deleted_lines: {% if ingress_internal and ingress_internal.ingress_path -%} WSGIScriptAlias {{ ingress_internal.ingress_path }} {{ wsgi_config.wsgi_public_script }}

commit_message:
Improve map_merge logging

Templates can be complex and contain multiple instances of
map_merges. Debugging this can be complex, so this change
aims to improve the mapping and help users determine where
the problem has occured.

Change-Id: I8661ae43fb86a842096e5ad86a54839feac04839

deleted_lines: msg = _('Incorrect arguments: Items to merge must be maps.')

commit_message:
WIP Drop python2 from bindep.txt

IPA dropped support for Python2 long ago,
and now Python2 is not even available in newer distros,
breaking installation if IPA binary dependencies.

WIP because we should consider switching the check-requirements job to
use a bionic node instead of jammy, or remove it entirely

Change-Id: I75a618f94de58f6de2bd96b37de1894bb0e61998
(cherry picked from commit 6e2f70ec7dc0de99c6f85499e50b80a3ea14c8d1)

commit_message:
proxy: Minimize cached shard-ranges for updating

We don't need to be dumping/loading whole shard ranges, just the name
and bounds. Hold off on instantiating the actual ShardRange object until
the last possible moment.

Change-Id: I448350ec59a697650b6f99ddfa8ff87f6f2e6a81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/03/852203/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import bisect document_iters_to_http_response_body, ShardRange, \ cache_key = get_cache_key(account, container, shard='updating-v2') if not cached_ranges: cached_ranges = [[str(sr.lower), sr.name] for sr in shard_ranges] if not cached_ranges: pos = bisect.bisect(cached_ranges, [obj]) - 1 lower, name = cached_ranges[pos] upper = ('' if pos + 1 == len(cached_ranges) else cached_ranges[pos + 1][0]) return ShardRange(name, Timestamp.now(), lower, upper)
deleted_lines: document_iters_to_http_response_body, ShardRange, find_shard_range, \ cache_key = get_cache_key(account, container, shard='updating') if cached_ranges: shard_ranges = [ ShardRange.from_dict(shard_range) for shard_range in cached_ranges] else: cached_ranges = [dict(sr) for sr in shard_ranges] if not shard_ranges: return find_shard_range(obj, shard_ranges)

commit_message:
container: Stop returning sharding ranges when already covered

Change-Id: I66c4ca93fedfcaaac50a2a161577cd4f4d25e51a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/21/852221/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # should maybe be its own thing, but for now, piggy-back off # fill_gaps -- basically, when listing and updating, we want to # minimize the intentional overlaps we return sharding_ranges = [sr for sr in shard_ranges if sr.state == ShardRange.SHARDING] for maybe_drop in sharding_ranges: children = [sr for sr in shard_ranges if maybe_drop.includes(sr) and sr != maybe_drop] if children and children[0].lower == maybe_drop.lower and \ all(a.upper == b.lower for a, b in zip(children, children[1:])) and \ children[-1].upper == maybe_drop.upper: shard_ranges.remove(maybe_drop)

Fix the condition for the cinder resource.

The disk must be also in status available not only be created.

Change-Id: I9d69e087bd8ab7fc5a1d34f94ca4882b06117829

subject: Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-26 13:45:24.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/415f34bfbe4252d045b63b6e60b673303d17904d', 'message': 'Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute

A typical pattern to check for a feature gate by a param and its role
param (there are more types of checking, this one is for negation):
foo_gate_enabled:
  not:
    and:
      - equals: [{get_param: foo_val}, <null_val>]
      - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, foo_val]}, <null_val>]

which is consider the feature gate OFF, only if both of its tht param
and role params are holding empty/falsey (null) values. If either holds
a not-null value, consider the condition is True, and treat the feature
gate as enabled.

For the nova compute service template, we follow that pattern when
checking permit_auto_converge_set, permit_post_copy_set,
reserved_huge_pages_set.

But we do not, when we check it for libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled
and nova_libvirt_max_queues_set. And consider the feature disabled, if
*either of* the tht, or role param holds a null value. As a result,
when we define NovaLibvirtMaxQueues, or NovaLibvirtFileBackedMemory,
but have nothing for those in roles params, the features will not
become enabled.

 Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Related: rhbz#2135675
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie16ab2ab5836ed455aeda35d2ba619633a595411
(cherry picked from commit 18824865c03efb702f34164408f2a95b1f58f417)
(cherry picked from commit ceb01aec509e3478424b8b71af3af158bed13727)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute

A typical pattern to check for a feature gate by a param and its role
param (there are more types of checking, this one is for negation):
foo_gate_enabled:
  not:
    and:
      - equals: [{get_param: foo_val}, <null_val>]
      - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, foo_val]}, <null_val>]

which is consider the feature gate OFF, only if both of its tht param
and role params are holding empty/falsey (null) values. If either holds
a not-null value, consider the condition is True, and treat the feature
gate as enabled.

For the nova compute service template, we follow that pattern when
checking permit_auto_converge_set, permit_post_copy_set,
reserved_huge_pages_set.

But we do not, when we check it for libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled
and nova_libvirt_max_queues_set. And consider the feature disabled, if
*either of* the tht, or role param holds a null value. As a result,
when we define NovaLibvirtMaxQueues, or NovaLibvirtFileBackedMemory,
but have nothing for those in roles params, the features will not
become enabled.

 Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Related: rhbz#2135675
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie16ab2ab5836ed455aeda35d2ba619633a595411
(cherry picked from commit 18824865c03efb702f34164408f2a95b1f58f417)
(cherry picked from commit ceb01aec509e3478424b8b71af3af158bed13727)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/862694/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: and: - or: - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, NovaLibvirtMaxQueues]}, ""] - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, NovaLibvirtMaxQueues]}, 0]

/var/log/containers/libvirt

subject: Refactor memcache config and MemcacheRing loading
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-12-07 02:43:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/6fd8d6f11da615bc8d7f51a58548d32c89c6f1e5', 'message': 'Refactor memcache config and MemcacheRing loading

The loading and creation of the Memcache ring in the middleware is
rather interesting. It not only reads the config file, but also may look
for a `/etc/swift/memcache.conf`. Further, we are know are looking at using
the MemcacheRing client in more places.

So this patch moves the config reading from the middleware and into a
`load_memcache` static helper method in swift/common/memcached.py.

Change-Id: I028722facfbe3ff8092b6bdcc931887a169cc49a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-12-09 04:28:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/b11fdc2b5630ca06a9eb1d9385ca6572bce1cfb7', 'message': 'Refactor memcache config and MemcacheRing loading

The loading and creation of the Memcache ring in the middleware is

commit_message:
Refactor memcache config and MemcacheRing loading

The loading and creation of the Memcache ring in the middleware is
rather interesting. It not only reads the config file, but also may
look for a `/etc/swift/memcache.conf`. Further, we are know are
looking at using the MemcacheRing client in more places.

So this patch moves the config reading from the middleware and
into a `load_memcache` helper method in swift/common/memcached.py.

Drive-by: cleanup unused stuff in middleware test module

Change-Id: I028722facfbe3ff8092b6bdcc931887a169cc49a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/48/820648/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.common.memcached import load_memcache from swift.common.utils import get_logger self.memcache = load_memcache(self, conf)
deleted_lines: import os from eventlet.green import ssl from six.moves.configparser import ConfigParser, NoSectionError, NoOptionError from swift.common.memcached import ( MemcacheRing, CONN_TIMEOUT, POOL_TIMEOUT, IO_TIMEOUT, TRY_COUNT, ERROR_LIMIT_COUNT, ERROR_LIMIT_TIME) from swift.common.utils import get_logger, config_true_value self.memcache_servers = conf.get('memcache_servers') serialization_format = conf.get('memcache_serialization_support') try: # Originally, while we documented using memcache_max_connections # we only accepted max_connections max_conns = int(conf.get('memcache_max_connections', conf.get('max_connections', 0))) except ValueError: max_conns = 0 memcache_options = {} if (not self.memcache_servers or serialization_format is None or max_conns <= 0): path = os.path.join(conf.get('swift_dir', '/etc/swift'), 'memcache.conf') memcache_conf = ConfigParser() if memcache_conf.read(path): # if memcache.conf exists we'll start with those base options try: memcache_options = dict(memcache_conf.items('memcache')) except NoSectionError: pass if not self.memcache_servers: try: self.memcache_servers = \ memcache_conf.get('memcache', 'memcache_servers') except (NoSectionError, NoOptionError): pass if serialization_format is None: try: serialization_format = \ memcache_conf.get('memcache', 'memcache_serialization_support') except (NoSectionError, NoOptionError): pass if max_conns <= 0: try: new_max_conns = \ memcache_conf.get('memcache', 'memcache_max_connections') max_conns = int(new_max_conns) except (NoSectionError, NoOptionError, ValueError): pass # while memcache.conf options are the base for the memcache # middleware, if you set the same option also in the filter # section of the proxy config it is more specific. memcache_options.update(conf) connect_timeout = float(memcache_options.get( 'connect_timeout', CONN_TIMEOUT)) pool_timeout = float(memcache_options.get( 'pool_timeout', POOL_TIMEOUT)) tries = int(memcache_options.get('tries', TRY_COUNT)) io_timeout = float(memcache_options.get('io_timeout', IO_TIMEOUT)) if config_true_value(memcache_options.get('tls_enabled', 'false')): tls_cafile = memcache_options.get('tls_cafile') tls_certfile = memcache_options.get('tls_certfile') tls_keyfile = memcache_options.get('tls_keyfile') self.tls_context = ssl.create_default_context( cafile=tls_cafile) if tls_certfile: self.tls_context.load_cert_chain(tls_certfile, tls_keyfile) else: self.tls_context = None error_suppression_interval = float(memcache_options.get( 'error_suppression_interval', ERROR_LIMIT_TIME)) error_suppression_limit = float(memcache_options.get( 'error_suppression_limit', ERROR_LIMIT_COUNT)) if not self.memcache_servers: self.memcache_servers = '127.0.0.1:11211' if max_conns <= 0: max_conns = 2 if serialization_format is None: serialization_format = 2 else: serialization_format = int(serialization_format) self.memcache = MemcacheRing( [s.strip() for s in self.memcache_servers.split(',') if s.strip()], connect_timeout=connect_timeout, pool_timeout=pool_timeout, tries=tries, io_timeout=io_timeout, allow_pickle=(serialization_format == 0), allow_unpickle=(serialization_format <= 1), max_conns=max_conns, tls_context=self.tls_context, logger=self.logger, error_limit_count=error_suppression_limit, error_limit_time=error_suppression_interval, error_limit_duration=error_suppression_interval)

commit_message:
Add legacy monolithic libvirt service for FFUv3

FFUv3 (Train->Wallaby) and mixed-rhel stories require possibility to
run modular libvirt on el9 hypervisors and monolithic libvirt on el8.

It is not clear yet if we might need a new ComputeEL8 role, or not.
Create legacy service OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirtLegacy to run
monolithic libvirt on such computes that are supposed to stay on
RHEL8.4 (el8) for some time.

Related: rhbz#2136163
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0476851066a5c3e22e09ff02ed4bb19a7eff71a7
